names.pinyin: xiang fu xuan fu hua tang

actions: With Xuan Fu Hua, for Thin Mucus in the hypochondria.
Expels Phlegm and removes pathogenic water.
With Zhi Ban Xia, for vomiting, coughing, wheezing and epigastric distention due to congested fluids.
Stops coughing, calms wheezing, descends Qi and dissolves Phlegm.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, descends Qi, relieves the diaphragm, Dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Fu Ling and Zhi Ban Xia, for a stifling sensation in the chest and coughing with excessive white, viscous sputum due to Phlegm-Damp Obstruction.
Promotes urination, strengthens the Spleen and leaches out Dampness.
With Zhi Ban Xia and Chen Pi, for nausea, vomiting, chest fullness and distention and anorexia due to congested fluids.
Strengthens the Spleen and resolves Dampness.
With Fu Ling, for Spleen Deficiency with Excess Dampness and edema.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm and descends Rebellious Qi.
With Chen Pi, for a productive cough and a stifling sensation in the chest due to Phlegm-Damp Obstruction or Spleen Qi Deficiency.
With Fu Ling, for Phlegm, thin mucus and turbid Dampness.

syndromes: Damp Stagnation in the Liver Channel

symptoms: Hypochondriac pain worse with coughing, breathing, spitting or turning from side to side
manifestations.pulse: Wiry or Deep and wiry or Slippery

modifications.purpose: severe chest, hypochondriac and flank distention and pain
